name: El Dorado Seaside Suites, by Karisma

reviews.title: Fantastic Honeymoon!
reviews.text: My husband and I went here for our Honeymoon and has a fantastic time. We have stayed at many AL places and this beats them hands down. Adults only and gorment food AL was a winner for us. There are buffets for breakfast and even one for lunch if you wanted it, however we prefered to order off the menu and were not dissapointed.

reviews.title: Beautiful, Romantic and Relaxing
reviews.text: The bar staff were excellent and also taught me spanish while I was sat at the bar. We had a middle room abovr the swim up bars, yes you can hear people above you so if it bothers you, you can ask to move, we were fine. The rooms were quiet large and the jacuzzi bath was lovely. Do not pay for an ocean or garden view as the palm trees have grown - that would be our one issues, they need to trim some of the palms back!

reviews.title: Would stay here again and again
reviews.text: The food was excellent, we especially enjoyed Vida where the food was stunning and it has a great atmostphere on thers as well. the waiters were lovely and always remembered our names. The mexican is being refurbished while we were there and the food was being served in the International restaurant and we really enjoyed that food there, as we did in all the resturants.

reviews.title: what a waste of money!!!
reviews.text: The beach isn't the typical white soft sandy beach, however it is still nice, yes there are sand bags, more near the spa end of the resport, however we stayed near the bar area looking towards the pier and always managed to get a four post swinging bed even though we didn't get to the beach until 10am some morning.

reviews.title: not as perfect as people say
reviews.text: The pier had been damaged during a storm and it would be nice to see it built back up. The section of the pier you can go on is nice and they even put wind breaks up when the wind picked up. I wouldnt let a storm damaged pier bother you like other posters on here!

reviews.title: It started so well..............
reviews.text: I did a lot of research before booking our trip to this hotel and read many reviews. I was concerned about the negative reviews but with so many positive comments we decided to give it a try,

reviews.title: It's the staff and food that brought us back!
reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel at 2am in the morning after being caught up in the snow delays at Gatwick. The reception was impressive and check in swift and efficient. We were even offered the champagne welcome despite the time. We stayed in an ocean view suite which as has been said before doesn't have much of an ocean view. However the room was large and comfortable. The jacuzzi bath is a nice touch. It is impossible to keep a constant temperature on the shower which became a pain after a while.

reviews.title: Fantastic Resort
reviews.text: The hotel grounds are immaculate and beautiful. There are people constantly working there cleaning and tidying. The beach is smaller than the brochure picture in First Choice but it was fine for us. Despite the rules of no towels on the beach beds before 7am this is not enforced. We had no trouble getting somewhere to sit though. The sand is rough but you can easily walk barefoot on it. For us the biggest surprised was at how cold the water was. There were people swimming and snorkelling there though, perhaps they were a bit more hardy. There are loads of fish to see and it was fun to feed them.

reviews.title: What a fantastic holiday!
reviews.text: If you want warm water to swim in my tip would be walk to the right of the resort about 500m, towards the flags, past the iguanas sunning themselves, There is soft sand and a much more pleasant sea temperature there. There is a beach butler service which is good. The ladies that we saw were very pleasant and happy. The spa staff are always trying to sell you the virtues of the spa. Mostly they will leave you alone after a polite 'no thanks' but one or two are more pushy.

reviews.title: Fantastic Honeymoon Resort - Would love to go back!
reviews.text: The food is nice and well presented. Some people complained that the portions were on the small side but we never went hungry. You have the option of a buffet breakfast as Arrecifes with a hot menu if required - this is also available at the Sandwicherie if you like sitting outdoors. A sit down breakfast is available at Vida on the days it's open. A quick option for lunch is the White Gazebo, which we went to often.

reviews.title: Nice, quiet place to stay, will visit again.
reviews.text: El Dorado seaside suites met my expectations. Some of the reviews I read were negative about food serving being to long of a wait, we did not experience that. All our meals were served within 30 minutes and the food was always excellent. We were there during what would be considered the low season and they were doing some renovation on the rooms above us, but only until around 5:00 pm, so when we headed back to our room from the beach to dress for dinner it was back to being peaceful. My only negative would be no free long distance calling from room and wifi was only available in the lobby for a fee.

reviews.title: Wonderful Vacation!
reviews.text: My husband and I travelled here with two other couples over the Thanksgiving holidays, to celebrate my birthday and both other couples' were celebrating their anniversaries. The staff were the awesome and made my birthday extra-special.

reviews.title: Relaxing and everyone is so friendly
reviews.text: All the staff members (front desk, concierge, bell captains, waiters, bartenders, housekeeping, etc.) were just the best. Everyone was friendly and professional. Carlos is one of the best bartenders around, was a lot of fun and kept us laughing.

reviews.title: Great Hotel for Couples
reviews.text: The food was wonderful. No complaints. We really enjoyed the beach bed cabanas. We took bread to the water and fed the fish. They would swim right up to you and actually take the bread out of your fingers! Mostly angel fish and some other yellow and black-striped ones.

reviews.title: Didn't Live Up to Expectations
reviews.text: Lastly, we met some of the most friendly and happiest people on the planet. We made friends with several British and Canadian couples. It was very refreshing to be on vacation and spend a week with new found friends who didn't walk around with a chip on their shoulders and a frown on their faces!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from two weeks at this resort and had a fabulous time. I'm not going to repeat what lots of people have already said so just a few pointers from my opinion. We've been to the Maldives twice on 5star AI and also Egypt a couple of times, so that's what I'm going to compare this to.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With regard to the AI I think this resort is fabulous value for money, excellent choice in food. There ARE buffets available for breakfast and lunch both at the Sandwicherie and the Arrecife if you want them so not sure what some people are complaining about here. These also provide a menu service if you prefer. The Italian restaurant does seem to have a long waiting time as there are not many tables. The Asian restaurant was great but its very dark in there!
reviews.title: Amazing Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you love cocktails then this place is fantastic we tried way too many! There are no cheap brands or watered down beverages. We also had a tequila tasting with the management one evening which was very enjoyable. If I'm really honest at times it was difficult to get served, usually when they were cleaning up from day time ready for the evening. To sum up there are very few restrictions to this AI. In the Maldives they even restrict the water!
reviews.title: Wonderfully romantic and nearly perfect...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: There ARE staff that come along the beach and pool to ask if you want drinks - again not sure what some people are complaining about here, we experienced a wonderful service from Rosa on the beach.
reviews.title: Nice Enough But Room For Improvement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach is not the best at this resort, we did see a lot better elsewhere in the area. That said is was quite nice, the sand is a little rougher due to the habitat of the sea in this area. I think that my partner and I have been pretty spoilt with the places that we have snorkelled and I think that if you are an experienced snorkelling enthusiast you may be disappointed with the lack of coral and fish. But there are plenty of trips that you can go on for snorkelling although in my opinion the excursions do seem expensive. My partner paid USD 99 for a 3 hour jet ski and snorkelling trip. We paid £130 for an all inclusive ticket to Xel Ha (food and drink included) additional activities here are extra.
reviews.title: Fabulous and Perfect 2 Weeks!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: If you are looking for a stress free holiday this is the hotel for you. Staff were friendly and very efficient. Lomas travel had a office on site and thier representative Luis Mancillas was very knowledgeable & friendly and was happy to reommend trips that suited your needs especially when visiting the country for the first.
reviews.title: Very relaxing holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If any couple (of any age), want a 1st class holiday in Mexico go to this hotel/complex. Absolutely every piece of service was outstanding, I would love to single out one area that was the best, it realy is not possible. Every member of staff from the General manager down, surpassed our best expectation many times over, restaurants & bars were faultless. Excursion were arranged to perfection.
reviews.title: I beleive in KISS, keep it simple sucker

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are a couple just book in at El Dorado Seaside Suites. Do it now, you will not regret it.
reviews.title: The Best week ever !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Roger & Margaret Ellis. UK.
reviews.title: A Great Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: It was our first stay in mexico and this hotel made our holiday a very special one!! If I could I would come back every year!!
reviews.title: Sets the Bar High!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I traveled here after getting a surprise deal. Basically, we paid a certain price (a lot cheaper than the usual prices of the karisma resorts) and we did not know which of the 3 karisma resorts we were going to until the 7 days before the trip. All 3 karisma resorts are beautiful though, and all located in the Riviera Maya, so we didn't care which one we got. We ended up getting the El Dorado Seaside Suites, which is the oldest of all 3 Karisma adults-only resorts, but we were still very happy with our deal. The food was INCREDIBLE. The environment was very relaxing. The entire time at the resort, we were treated like royalty. It was secluded and clean...not commercialized like other resorts near Cancun. The beach was beautiful, but the only problem was you could not walk very far away from the resort because then the beach got dirty. We just had the basic room and we were very pleased. And have I mentioned the FOOD?! INCREDIBLE!! I had never heard of gourmet all inclusive until this trip, but it was well worth it. This was a very romantic resort for couples...not a place you would go to party hard, but they did have a good social atmosphere as well. It was also interesting because there were lots of Europeans at this resort, which we were not used to. And if you go and listen to an hour presentation about their Exotic Traveler's Club, you get a voucher for spa services, excursions, etc. We used our voucher to check out Hidden Beach next door...which is Karisma's version of a nude beach. It was a great experience, not something we thought we would end up doing, but so fun!
reviews.title: wonderful/beautiful resort, not brand new though. oldest of all 3 karisma resorts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This all-inclusive hotel is aimed at couples which is quite at odds with the very late night bar and disco which kept us awake on our first night, meaning we had to move to another room the following day - this took time to sort out but we were able to switch to an equally good room with an excellent location near to the nicer part of the beach. Arturro was very helpful with that and was very patient as we checked-out a number of alternative rooms before settling on one.
reviews.title: Great but not perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The quality of the food in the restaurants is very good, unexpected for an all-inclusive package - the best evening dining is at the Mia Casa Italian restaurant and The Arrecife, followed by the Tay Kalay Asian restaurant (though the Nasi Goreng wasn't that great or even authentic). The food at La Carreta Mexican restaurant was pretty good but the service was pretty poor, with our waiter seemingly sulking because we didn't opt for the $40 USD bottle of wine he tried very hard to sell us - we opted for the very good house red which we had every night at each restaurant.
reviews.title: Overbooking Mismanagement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: For breakfast La Vida is very nice as is Arrecife, but we had breakfast at the former almost every day; the open-air Sandwicherie also does breakfast.
reviews.title: Simply amazing!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For lunch, the Sandwicherie is very good for burgers and tortillas but we ended up mostly at the beach barbeque which is very good and has burgers, nachos with chilli/cheese, chicken, sausage and a daily special ranging from ribs, seafood paella and fish.
reviews.title: Relax and Chill

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very pretty resort, with beautiful grounds which were excellently tended and lovely to walk around you see beautiful yellow and blue birds and Iguanas. We enjoyed the choice of restaurants with no pre booking, and we used the bar by the Italian restaurant as it was quieter at night there, the food was excellent with lots of choice, our room was 2711 which did have a beach view and we could see the sea but with palm trees up higher it still was a lovely view and it was spotlessly cleaned by Pilar. There is also a wonderful peaceful spa, expensive prices so ask what deal/offer they have on if you fancy treating yourself. The beach was nice but uncomfortable to walk on as it was shingle type white sand which was a shame. We always got a sunbed but we are early risers. Our only comment (not complaint) was we could have been anywhere in the Caribbean as there is not a lot of Mexican music or flavour here which is a shame but it did not stop us enjoying our wonderful holiday. Thanks to Janet and Elmer at the bar we will miss you guys (and the Mimosa's).
reviews.title: Wonderful 2 weeks of being spoilt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is one of the best places we`ve been to. Ths staff, food, everything is absolutely wonderful. During our two weeks stay, neither myself or my wife felt any ilness what so ever.
reviews.title: Fantastic Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are frequent travellers and have been to luxurious places in Dom. Rep, Venezuela. Kuba and Mexico and we can truly say that this Resort is GOOD.
reviews.title: Immaculate resort, but lacking something

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food: Italien and Vida Garden, they are as good as something can be, lovely food.
reviews.title: Worth a 11 hour flight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mexican and the Asian, both OK but not at all as good as the other two.
reviews.title: "Amazing hotel, cannot wait to return"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are so many positive things to say about this resort:
reviews.title: Many, many positives, very relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. The staff are committed to customer satisfaction. If there is something that you are disappointed in, they will make it right. I saw countless instances of this.
reviews.title: Nice Resort - Very Relaxing Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: 2. I went to the front desk to inquire about the occupancy rate, it was 95%, yet the property seems almost empty.
reviews.title: Great Resort awwwwesome service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. The towel game is definitely played, yet there was never, at any time, an issue with getting a lounger, palapa or hammock.
reviews.title: Wonderful vacation!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 4. Top shelf liquor, just ask for it.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel let down by the food poisoning
